ygData.subject: Re: Warriors vs Wizards
ygData.msgSnippet: OK.  You rmaking some sense.  Let s try and put together a reasonable offer. 1) Critical Hit as a Warrior only skill (maybe add Monk) 2) Remove skill caps for
ygData.messageBody:
OK. You rmaking some sense. Let's try and put together a reasonable offer.

1) Critical Hit as a Warrior only skill (maybe add Monk)

2) Remove skill caps for warrior on the following skills: Offense, Defense,
Dual weild, Dble attack.

3) add specialization in weapons forms (1-handed slash, 2- handed slash,
archery, etc.)

4) Add a once a day ability Battle Cry (As a barbarian I really like this)
That temporarily enhances fighting abilities.

5) Increase the effects of strength on damage and stamina on healing, but
not drastically. Since these are primary attributes for a warrior this
should help us out in being more effective in the early stages of combat and
get us off our butts a little faster afterwards.


what do you think?



> -----Original Message-----
> From: James Wofford [mailto:James.Wofford@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 9:20 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Warriors vs Wizards
>
>
> From: James Wofford <James.Wofford@...>
>
> I am in agreement as well.... Short of the fact that warriors
> are needed in
> high level groups. Let me backtrack a little bit. Warriors
> at the lower
> levels are far superior to hybrid classes in general. But at
> the higer
> levels, the hybrids have gained so many abilities and extras that the
> warrior is overshadowed by the attributes of a hybrid. Also,
> a hybrid can
> fulfill the same role that a warrior can at those higher
> levels just as well
> as a warrior can. A warrior also has very little ability at
> higher levels
> to use his taunt, bue to lack of damage inflicted to a mob.
> I find this
> happeneing to me at level 30 already. How bad will this be
> at level 40?
> The lack of a warrior being able to get a mob off the casters
> will make his
> worth in the battle less. Therefore groups will be more
> inclined to chose a
> hybrid class as their tank. This will cause a loss of people actually
> playing warriors in the game, leading to the downfall of the
> class as a
> whole.
>
> As for wizards/warrior argument. Warriors are not supposed
> to do the damage
> a wizard can do. we are there as the shield so they can lay
> down the damage
> at will....
>
> If you get into a good group that is working well together.
> Where everyone
> in the group knows there place in the group organization.
> Wizards become
> the secondary source of damage, not the primary. If they
> nuke to soon, they
> are mobbed, they have to hold their spells in check until the
> right time to
> burn down the mob. Yes, they do put some small burns into
> the middle of the
> battle, but they shouldnt let loose the great damage spells
> until late in
> the battle. This is the true place where warriors shine.
> But even at that,
> by the time the battle nears where its time for the wizards power, the
> warrior has done little except take alot of damage. IMO we
> should be able
> to help with some of the beginning portion of battles more
> than what we do.
>
> I am thinking that the majority of us agree on the critical
> hit issue. How
> do we feel about the specialization skills? Also, remember
> that we cap all
> of our skills (that didnt cap earlier) at 200. Some of the
> hybrid classes
> continue to be able to gain in skills past that. I feel we
> should be able
> to remove that cap on our skill and continue to progress in
> them. We are
> warriors, we never stop learning our art.
>
> Dyvim Kincaid
> Stormriders of Cazic Thule
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Zwanenburg, John [mailto:ZWANENJ@...]
> > Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 8:53 AM
> > To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Warriors vs Wizards
> >
> >
> > From: "Zwanenburg, John" <ZWANENJ@...>
> >
> > I whole heartedly agree with you wayne.
> >
> > The game is about balance. Some people are saying that a
> group of really
> > high levels do not need warriors. I say thats BS my friends
> always want my
> > warrior in their group. Not just becuase im company mind
> you. Because they
> > are spell casters. If im not there, the MOB would latch
> onto them and
> > interrupt their casting.
> >
> > Sure we could beg verant for one more skill .... critical
> hit , which is a
> > very good idea. And i like the idea of it being like
> ripsote and parry.
> > Makes more sense. But the fact of the matter is this: We
> are there to
> > prevent our spellcasting buddies from being hit by
> creatures so that THEY
> > can dish out the damage. I have never had anyone complain to me
> > and say look
> > man we dont want you in the group anymore cause you doont dish
> > out the most
> > damage.
> >
> > Every group needs a good strong warrior.
> >
> > John
> >
> > > ----------
> > > From: Wayne Sheppard[SMTP:mrwayne@...]
> > > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > > Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 10:26 AM
> > > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > > Subject: [warriors_eq] Warriors vs Wizards
> > >
> > > From: "Wayne Sheppard" <mrwayne@...>
> > >
> > > Many of the Warriors here have complained that they
> cannot do damage as
> > > fast
> > > as a Wizard.
> > >
> > > THEY ARE NOT SUPPOSED TO.
> > >
> > > Now all of you real life ninjas and steel sword swinging
> fools just calm
> > > down. Read carefully.
> > >
> > >
> > > Warriors get to wear platemail and have many more hps
> than a Wizard.
> > > Warriors also have a higher Offense, Defense, and Weapon
> > skills. This all
> > > means that a Warrior can stand toe to toe against an NPC.
> > >
> > > Now lets make a Warrior have the same ability to deal damage as
> > a Wizard.
> > > Now we would have a class that has the best armor, the
> highest combat
> > > skills, the most hp's AND the ability to deal the most damage.
> > >
> > > Why would anyone want to play a Wizard if a Warrior could
> do as much
> > > damage
> > > AND be able to take blows in melee?
> > >
> > >
> > > Wayne
> > > PS - When someone says that a Warrior should be able to
> deal as much
> > > damage
> > > as fast as a Wizard I immediately realize this person doesn't
> > have a clue
> > > about game balance.
> > >
> > >
> > >
